intro: Sida gorgonea, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, pale purple to white flowers. Its fibrous stems and hairy foliage are characteristic of the Malvaceae family. Sida gorgonea is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
